question: Sodium and chlorine are reacted, and as a result, sodium chloride is formed, which is also called table salt. What option gives the reactants and products of the reaction?

options.b: Reactants – sodium and table salt; products – chlorine
options.c: Reactants – tables salt; products – sodium and chlorine
options.d: Reactants – sodium and chlorine; products – sodium chloride

question: Which of the following reaction can also be termed a thermal decomposition reaction?
The image shows some chemical reactions. Which option identifies the reactants and products of the reactions?

options.a: Option A: Reactants – Magnesium ribbon, Products – Magnesium oxide; Option B: Reactants – Lead nitrate, Products – Lead oxide and Nitrogen dioxide
options.b: Option A: Reactants – Magnesium ribbon, Products – Magnesium oxide; Option B: Reactants – Carbon dioxide, Products – Lead oxide and Nitrogen dioxide
options.c: Option A: Reactants – Magnesium ribbon, Products – Magnesium oxide; Option B: Reactants – Lead nitrate, Products – Lead oxide and Nitrogen dioxide
options.d: Option A: Reactants – Magnesium oxide, Products – Magnesium ribbon; Option B: Reactants – Lead nitrate, Products – Lead oxide and Nitrogen dioxide

question: A student performs an experiment to form aluminium chloride from aluminium and chlorine. Which of the following option gives the chemical equation of the reaction?
Give the ratio in which hydrogen and oxygen are present in water by volume.
A researcher adds barium hydroxide to hydrochloric acid to form a white-coloured barium chloride. Which of the following option gives the balanced chemical equation of the reaction?
One of the following processes does not involve a chemical reaction, that is:

options.a: Melting of candle wax when heated
options.b: Burning of candle wax when heated
options.c: Digestion of food in your stomach

question: A student wrote a chemical equation of the reaction between carbon monoxide and hydrogen as, CO2 + 2H2 → CH3OH. How can the reaction be classified?

options.a: The reaction is an example of a combination reaction as a compound separates into two compounds.
options.b: The reaction is an example of a decomposition reaction as a compound dissociates into two compounds.
options.c: The reaction is an example of a combination reaction as two compounds react to form a single compound.
options.d: The reaction is an example of a decomposition reaction as two compounds react to form a single compound.

question: The chemical formula of magnesium oxide is _____.

A student learns that some products are formed as a result of combining two compounds while some compounds are formed as a result of the dissociation of two compounds. The image shows two reactions. Which reaction is an example of a combination reaction and a decomposition reaction?

options.a: Both reactions are examples of combination reaction
options.b: Both reactions are examples of a decomposition reaction
options.c: Reaction P is an example of a combination reaction, while reaction Q is an example of a decomposition reaction
options.d: Reaction P is an example of a decomposition reaction, while reaction Q is an example of a combination reaction

question: From the following, which one is an example of a chemical reaction?

A student adds lead and silver to two different test tubes containing an equal amount of copper sulphate solution. The student observes that the colour of the solution in the test tube with lead changes. What explains the change in the colour of the solution?

options.a: A displacement reaction takes place as lead replaces copper from the solution.
options.b: A combination reaction takes place as lead combines with sulphate in the solution.
options.c: A decomposition reaction takes place as copper dissociates from sulphate in the solution.
options.d: A double displacement reaction takes place as copper dissociates from sulphate and lead combines with sulphate in the solution.

question: Which of the following reactions is used in black-and-white photography?
What happens when lead nitrate reacts with potassium iodide?

options.b: A large amount of hydrogen will be released
options.c: Yellow ppt of lead iodide and potassium nitrate will be produced

question: The chemical reaction between potassium chloride and silver nitrate is given by the chemical equation, AgNO3 + KCl → AgCl + KNO3. What can be inferred from the chemical equation?

options.a: Silver nitrate and potassium undergo a decomposition reaction to form silver chloride and potassium nitrate
options.b: Silver nitrate and potassium undergo a displacement reaction to form silver chloride and potassium nitrate
options.c: Silver nitrate and potassium undergo a combination reaction to form silver chloride and potassium nitrate
options.d: Silver nitrate and potassium undergo a double displacement reaction to form silver chloride and potassium nitrate

question: Which of the following shows an oxidation reaction?
The image shows a reaction between zinc and hydrogen. Which option shows oxidation?
